PRIVACY IMPACT ASSESSMENT (PIA)

 

Before completing this form and preparing the required documents, please ensure that you have consulted with the Privacy Education and Assessments (PEA) Center of the Privacy Office (PO). 

Guidance on the conduct of the PIA 

The primary objective of the PIA is to identify, assess, evaluate, and manage the privacy and security risks associated with the processing of Personal Information and Sensitive Personal Information (collectively, “Personal Data”). 

When you accomplish this PIA and submit to the PO-PEA Center, you: 

  1. Warrant that all information you have provided about the Project is true and correct as of the date of the PIA's submission; and
  2. Acknowledge that the declaration of any false, incomplete, or misleading information shall result in disciplinary action in accordance with the applicable provisions of your Entity’s Code of Discipline and other related corporate policies, without prejudice to the filing of civil and/or criminal actions when warranted. 

 Instructions in the accomplishment of the PIA

  1. Do not change any portion of this document or leave any section blank. If an item is not applicable to your Project, simply indicate “Not Applicable”.
  2. The PIA should be written in a manner that makes it understandable to an outsider (i.e., not from the PLDT Group). Avoid the usage of undefined acronyms. Be reminded that the PIA is an artifact of privacy compliance; a copy may be requested by the National Privacy Commission (“NPC”) as part of a Compliance Check.
  3. Please submit the following Supporting Artifacts (as may be applicable) together with the accomplished PIA to the PO-PEA Center: 
 
    • Data collection forms and corresponding drafts of the Privacy Notice and Consent Form; 
    • CX Flow for the (a) presentation of Privacy Notices / Consent Language, (b) obtaining consent, and (c) exercise of privacy rights;
    • Personal Data Flow throughout each phase of the Data Lifecycle : Collection, Use and Disclosure, Retention, and Disposal (please limit to Personal Data only, and exclude other types of information assets);
    • Contracts with all involved third-parties, including Subsidiaries and Affiliates; and
    • Any other material (presentation deck, videos, high level business process maps, written procedures or guidelines) that will help the Reviewer understand the Project better.  

The PIA should be accomplished by the Project SPOC (Single Point of Contact), and endorsed by the Project Owner. Once completed, please email it to your PO-PEA representative, together with any relevant supporting document/s, for initial assessment. The issuance of a Privacy Assessment Memo (PAM) for your Project signifies the completion of the end-to-end PIA process.  

Depending on the Project’s complexity and scope of Personal Data processing, the end-to-end PIA process may require 4-6 weeks to complete, which commences on the day that the PIA is submitted together with all the Supporting Artifacts noted by your PO-PEA representative during the Project consultation / walkthrough session.
